org.jtrim.concurrent

Class ExecutorConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.concurrent.ExecutorConverter

  • public final class ExecutorConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines static method to convert between the executors of JTrim and the executors of Java. That is, conversion between ExecutorService and TaskExecutorService; and conversion between Executor and TaskExecutor.

    Note that these conversions have limitations and may not provide all the features required for the particular interface. The converter methods document these limitations.

    For convenience, converting executors back and forth does not endlessly wrap the executors. That is, wrapping and then unwrapping an executor will yield the exact same executor.

    This class cannot be inherited nor instantiated.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

    • Method Detail

      • asExecutorService

        public static java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService asExecutorService(TaskExecutorService executor)
        Returns an ExecutorService backed by the specified TaskExecutorService. That is, every task submitted to the returned ExecutorService will be forwarded to the specified TaskExecutorService.

        Nota that this method was designed so that: asTaskExecutorService(asExecutorService(executor)) == executor holds for every non-null TaskExecutorService instances.

        Limitations
        Tasks scheduled to the returned ExecutorService will never be interrupted, even if the submitted task has been canceled. If the task is not yet executing, it will be canceled.

        The shutdownNow() will cancel executing every tasks not yet started executing but will always return an empty list of Runnable instances.

        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutorService to which tasks submitted to the returned ExecutorService will be forwarded to. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the ExecutorService backed by the specified TaskExecutorService. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified TaskExecutorService is null

      • asExecutorService

        public static java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService asExecutorService(TaskExecutorService executor,
                                                     boolean mayInterruptTasks)
        Returns an ExecutorService backed by the specified TaskExecutorService. That is, every task submitted to the returned ExecutorService will be forwarded to the specified TaskExecutorService.

        Nota that this method was designed so that: asTaskExecutorService(asExecutorService(executor, b)) == executor holds for every b and non-null TaskExecutorService instances.

        Limitations
        Tasks scheduled to the returned ExecutorService will only be interrupted, if mayInterruptTasks is true, otherwise cancellation request will be ignored after the task has been started. If the task is not yet executing, it will be canceled.

        The shutdownNow() will cancel executing every tasks not yet started executing (and will interrupt them if mayInterruptTasks is true) but will always return an empty list of Runnable instances.

        Warning: Allowing the tasks to be interrupted can be dangerous in some cases. That is, if it is not known what thread the executor may execute tasks (such is the case for SyncTaskExecutor), the executing thread may associate unwanted meaning to thread interruption. Allowing thread interruption is generally safe with ThreadPoolExecutor instances.

        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutorService to which tasks submitted to the returned ExecutorService will be forwarded to. This argument cannot be null.
        mayInterruptTasks - if true the thread executing the task will be interrupted upon cancellation requests, otherwise the executing thread will not be interrupted
        Returns:
        the ExecutorService backed by the specified TaskExecutorService. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified TaskExecutorService is null

      • asTaskExecutorService

        public static TaskExecutorService asTaskExecutorService(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
        Returns a TaskExecutorService backed by the specified ExecutorService. That is, every task submitted to the returned TaskExecutorService will be forwarded to the specified ExecutorService.

        Nota that this method was designed so that: asExecutorService(asTaskExecutorService(executor)) == executor holds for every non-null ExecutorService instances.

        Limitations
        Note that there is no guarantee in general that an ExecutorService will execute a task (in fact, it will not execute it after it has been shutted down). Therefore, it is possible that the returned TaskExecutorService will fail to execute cleanup tasks.
        Parameters:
        executor - the ExecutorService to which tasks submitted to the returned TaskExecutorService will be forwarded to. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the TaskExecutorService backed by the specified ExecutorService. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified ExecutorService is null

      • asTaskExecutor

        public static TaskExecutor asTaskExecutor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Returns a TaskExecutor backed by the specified Executor. That is, every task submitted to the returned TaskExecutor will be forwarded to the specified Executor.

        Nota that this method was designed so that: asExecutor(asTaskExecutor(executor)) == executor holds for every non-null Executor instances.

        Limitations
        Note that there is no guarantee in general that an Executor will execute a task. Therefore, it is possible that the returned TaskExecutor will fail to execute cleanup tasks.
        Parameters:
        executor - the Executor to which tasks submitted to the returned TaskExecutor will be forwarded to. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the TaskExecutor backed by the specified Executor. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified Executor is null

      • asExecutor

        public static java.util.concurrent.Executor asExecutor(TaskExecutor executor)
        Returns an Executor backed by the specified TaskExecutor. That is, every task submitted to the returned Executor will be forwarded to the specified TaskExecutor.

        Nota that this method was designed so that: asTaskExecutor(asExecutor(executor)) == executor holds for every non-null TaskExecutor instances.

        The returned Executor has no limitations as an Executor (since there is not much thing an Executor mandates).

        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutor to which tasks submitted to the returned Executor will be forwarded to. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the Executor backed by the specified TaskExecutor. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified TaskExecutor is null
